gcci.text: At $3.21/hour for H100s, cloud providers are optimizing capex recovery cycles while supply chain constraints create strategic inventory advantages for hyperscalers able to secure multi-year commitments.

gtpi.text: The $1.25/1M input token price point signals aggressive API commoditization, forcing model providers to differentiate through inference efficiency and specialized capabilities rather than pure price competition.

gagl.text: AI's 120 TWh annual load represents grid infrastructure stress that accelerates nuclear and renewable baseload adoption while necessitating intelligent load scheduling and power purchase agreement restructuring.

aipi.text: Converging AI infrastructure costs reveal a maturing market where sustainable growth depends on balancing capital efficiency with rapid capability expansion, mitigating bubble risks through proven enterprise ROI.
